availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Consisted of Garrard, Madison, Estill, Rockcastle, Jackson, Owsley, Breathitt, Johnson, Floyd, Pike, Laurel, Clay, Perry, Letcher, Whitley, Knox, and Harlan counties between 1861 and 1863. Consisted of Trimble, Carroll, Gallatin, Boone, Keaton, Campbell, Grant, Pendleton, Bracken, and Harrison counties between 1863 and 1865. Represented by Green Adams from 1859 to 1861. Represented by George W. Dunlap from 1861 to 1863. Represented by Green Clay Smith from 1863 to 1865.

ab.bibl: Patrick Lewis, “Visualizing Unionism: Congressional Redistricting in 1861,” Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition blog, April 27, 2016, https://civilwargovernors.org/visualizing-unionism-congressional-redistricting-in-1861/ (accessed December 26, 2019). “Congressional and Judicial District Maps, Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition, http://discovery.civilwargovernors.org/congressional-and-judicial-district-maps (accessed December 26, 2019). KYR-0004-033-0003.
